ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: For scientists and data managers to create high quality EML metadata for dataset publication. EMLassemblyline is optimized for automating recurring publications (timeseries or data derived from timeseries sources) but works well for "one-off" publications, especially through the MetaShARK interface. EMLassemblyline prioritizes automated metadata extraction from data objects to minimize required human effort and encourages EML best practices to make publications Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable.

For scientists and data managers to create high quality EML metadata for dataset publication. EMLassemblyline is optimized for automating recurring publications (timeseries or data derived from timeseries sources) but works well for "one-off" publications, especially through the MetaShARK interface. EMLassemblyline prioritizes automated metadata extraction from data objects to minimize required human effort and encourages EML best practices to make publications Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable.

name: r-emlassemblyline

about.summary: For scientists and data managers to create high quality EML metadata for dataset publication. EMLassemblyline is optimized for automating recurring publications (timeseries or data derived from timeseries sources) but works well for "one-off" publications, especially through the MetaShARK interface. EMLassemblyline prioritizes automated metadata extraction from data objects to minimize required human effort and encourages EML best practices to make publications Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "3.6.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-emlassemblyline
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/EDIorg/EMLassemblyline/archive/refs/tags/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e5256dca1a5102567cd281da84d6d0c879abd26dd1a776013b9d571a99e5740e

build:
  number: 0
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-bit64
    - r-data.table
    - r-eml >=2.0.5
    - r-httr
    - r-knitr
    - r-mime
    - r-reader
    - r-readr
    - r-rmarkdown
    - r-stringr
    - r-stringi
    - r-taxonomycleanr >=1.6.7
    - r-tidyr
    - r-uuid
    - r-xml2
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-bit64
    - r-data.table
    - r-eml >=2.0.5
    - r-httr
    - r-knitr
    - r-mime
    - r-reader
    - r-readr
    - r-rmarkdown
    - r-stringr
    - r-stringi
    - r-taxonomycleanr >=1.6.7
    - r-tidyr
    - r-uuid
    - r-xml2

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('EMLassemblyline')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('EMLassemblyline')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/EDIorg/EMLassemblyline
  license: MIT
  summary: For scientists and data managers to create high quality EML metadata for dataset publication. EMLassemblyline is optimized for automating recurring publications (timeseries or data derived from timeseries sources) but works well for "one-off" publications, especially through the MetaShARK interface. EMLassemblyline
    prioritizes automated metadata extraction from data objects to minimize required human effort and encourages EML best practices to make publications Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - marie59

# Package: EMLassemblyline
# Type: Package
# Title: A tool kit for building EML metadata workflows
# Version: 3.5.5
# Author:c(person("Colin", "Smith", email = "colin.smith@wisc.edu", role = c("aut", "cre"), comment = "https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2261-9931"),
#    person("Elie", "ARNAUD", email = "earnaud@outlook.com", role = "ctb", comment = "https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3416-7653"),
#    person(given = "Kyle", family = "Zollo-Venecek", role = c("ctb"), comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0002-1615-590X")))
# Maintainer: Smith Colin <colin.smith@wisc.edu>
# Description: For scientists and data managers to create high quality EML metadata for dataset publication. EMLassemblyline is optimized for automating recurring publications (timeseries or data derived from timeseries sources) but works well for "one-off" publications, especially through the MetaShARK interface. EMLassemblyline prioritizes automated metadata extraction from data objects to minimize required human effort and encourages EML best practices to make publications Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable.
# Depends: R (>= 2.14)
# Suggests: testthat
# License: MIT
# URL: https://github.com/EDIorg/EMLassemblyline
# BugReports: https://github.com/EDIorg/EMLassemblyline/issues
# LazyData: true
# RoxygenNote: 7.1.1
# Packaged: 
# NeedsCompilation: yes
# Repository: github
# Date/Publication:

EMLassemblyline is optimized for automating recurring publications (timeseries or data derived from timeseries sources) but works well for "one-off" publications, especially through the MetaShARK interface. EMLassemblyline prioritizes automated metadata extraction from data objects to minimize required human effort and encourages EML best practices to make publications Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable.
